snippet: United States health officials say they aim to test a vaccine shown to protect macaque monkeys as early as next month.
abstract: United States health officials say they are planning fast-track development of an Ebola vaccine, aiming to test it as early as September; scientists warn task is arduous and success is hardly guaranteed, particularly in light of fact that financial investment from pharmaceutical industry is perhaps most crucial contingency.
lead_paragraph: United States health officials say they aim to test a vaccine shown to protect macaque monkeys as early as next month.

headline.main: Ebola Vaccine Possible, but Many Doubts Persist
headline.print_headline: Ebola Vaccine Possible, but Many Doubts Persist
